intro: Amorphophallus aculatum, commonly known as the giant arrowhead, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large,戟-shaped (spear-shaped) leaves and a striking, spadix-like inflorescence that can reach up to 3 meters in height. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are often fragrant and attract pollinators such as flies and beetles. Its tuberous roots are used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some regions. The plant thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in rainforests.
